system.description:
For some, the weapon is more than a tool, it is a way of life, and they dedicate themselves fully to achieving full mastery of one in particular.  They dedicate themselves to studying all aspects of their chosen implement, training to fight with their mind as much as their arm.  To such weapon masters, the weapon is an extension of themselves.  You gain the following benefits:

  • You gain a +1 bonus to your choice of your Intelligence, Strength, or Dexterity score, to a maximum value of 20.
  • You gain proficiency with a rare weapon of your choice.  Choose one weapon you are proficient in as your Mastered Weapon.  When using such a weapon to perform a maneuver, your maneuver DC is increased by 2.  
  • You gain the @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-class-features.Item.v4pkjilh484jph6i]{Precision Strikes} scholar ability if you do not already have it, or @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-class-features.Item.okthtwyohmh0eoa5]{Mystic Apprentice} if you do.  If gaining Mystic Apprentice from this feat or from class levels after taking this feat, you must take @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-spells.Item.7mwrwjjj3mn4yzxr]{Altered Strike} and the rare spell @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-spells.Item.3pkt6rf4932i1pg0]{Greater True Strike} as your two cantrips.  If you already have Mystic Apprentice from before taking this feat, you may choose to swap your chosen cantrips for these when you take this feat.  When using altered strike with your Mastered Weapon, you may choose to add your Intelligence modifier or your Strength or Dexterity modifier to attack and damage rolls, instead of having to use your Intelligence.  When casting greater true strike, you may expend a hit die to instead do so as a bonus action.
system.prerequisite: 3 Levels in Scholar, 3 Levels in Fighter
